content:
You can't really make the case that OpenAI is critical. You have Gemini, Claude, Copilot, WTF-ever Meta's is, and MechaHitler, none of which are in any danger.

The wildcard is the tech right in Trump's administration. A16z, Sequoia, Craft, etc are invested in OpenAI, not GOOGL or MSFT.

Yep, better to cash out now b/4 hyperscalers like GOOG, AMZN and MSFT swamp the startups and end up dominating the early-stage AI market.

Its actually too bad that the US no longer has a serious Antitrust regime, b/c without one OpenAI and Anthropic are roadkill.

Cloud compute provider Vultr to build a 50MW cluster of #AMD AI processors at a datacenter in Ohio. Important development, because whereas #MSFT #META #GOOGL and others are building these huge, expensive datacenters, Vultr is building these small, cheap datacenters.
Emphasis on cheap.
MSFT has reasonably good access to openai even today. Their copilots still suck. MSFT is good when its acquisitions are free to run independently.
#NVDA #MSFT NVIDIA, MICROSOFT PARTNER WITH MISTRAL AI

My MS Office subscription went up by a few bucks after the Copilot rollout. Microsoft is (and will keep getting) my money while I also use free accts on Gemini, etc. $MSFT is already winning in that respect.

Amazon is uniquely placed to get over that bump though. By using their own chip themselves, they can impose it to a critical mass (themselves, their own servers).

CUDA is not something a guy in his basement can replicate. Even for AMZN, MSFT or GOOG, it will take ...
